Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land (e.g., a garden or forest) and one in water (e.g., a pond or stream).
The student can illustrate at least three different types of living things (e.g., plants, animals) in each habitat.
The student can show specific examples of plants and animals for each habitat, such as trees or bushes for land habitats, and fish or clams for water habitats.
The student can compare the diversity of living things in the two habitats through their drawings (e.g., showing different plants and animals in each habitat).
The student can identify patterns by observing similarities and differences between the types of living things found in each habitat.
